etymologies: 1930s: from modern Latin Anapsida, from Greek an- ‘without’ + apsis, apsid- ‘arch’

definitions: a reptile of a group characterized by the lack of temporal openings in the skull, including the turtles and their relatives.

notes.text: Sometimes placed in a subclass Anapsida, though this taxon is now often not recognized

shortDefinitions: reptile of group characterized by lack of temporal openings in skull, including turtles and their relatives and many early fossil forms
